intro: Restio obscurus, commonly known as the dark restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance and tall, cylindrical spikelets. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowering occurs in spring, producing small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Restio obscurus plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
